column4: Hello, could someone help me with partitioning my hard drive?
general rule: use two parts: one for swap at RAM x2 and one for /.  Anything else requires you to know more about your system usage than you might wish to be bothered with.
Well, the problem is that i can't resize my windows partition no matter what i try
have you tried burning a liveCD of qparted and used it to resize your windows part?

ok, do this. google qparted and download the livecd ISO.  Burn that to a CD and then boot to it.  Use the default options and you will be presented with an interface that will let you resize your existing partitions
